title: demo
text: demo, use standard packages processing raw geolocator data. haven’t installed , use following lines:
code: devtools::install_github("GeoPressureR") library(GeoPressureR) library(raster) #> Loading required package: sp library(rgdal) #> Please note that rgdal will be retired by the end of 2023, #> plan transition to sf/stars/terra functions using GDAL and PROJ #> at your earliest convenience. #>  #> rgdal: version: 1.5-27, (SVN revision 1148) #> Geospatial Data Abstraction Library extensions to R successfully loaded #> Loaded GDAL runtime: GDAL 3.2.1, released 2020/12/29 #> Path to GDAL shared files: /Library/Frameworks/R.framework/Versions/4.1/Resources/library/rgdal/gdal #> GDAL binary built with GEOS: TRUE  #> Loaded PROJ runtime: Rel. 7.2.1, January 1st, 2021, [PJ_VERSION: 721] #> Path to PROJ shared files: /Library/Frameworks/R.framework/Versions/4.1/Resources/library/rgdal/proj #> PROJ CDN enabled: FALSE #> Linking to sp version:1.4-5 #> To mute warnings of possible GDAL/OSR exportToProj4() degradation, #> use options("rgdal_show_exportToProj4_warnings"="none") before loading sp or rgdal. #> Overwritten PROJ_LIB was /Library/Frameworks/R.framework/Versions/4.1/Resources/library/rgdal/proj library(leaflet) library(ggplot2)

title: demo
text: Load hoopoe data set basic information track
code: #print(system.file("extdata", "/", package = "GeoPressureR")) PAM_data = create_import(pathname = system.file("extdata", "/", package = "GeoPressureR") ) lon.calib = 17.05    lat.calib = 48.9 crop.start = as.POSIXct("2017-06-20","%Y-%m-%d", tz="UTC") crop.end = as.POSIXct("2018-05-01","%Y-%m-%d", tz="UTC")

title: demo
text: Using PalmR package, crop data classify activity. See possible classification https://kiranlda.github.io/PAMLrManual/index.html
code: PAM_data = create_crop(PAM_data,crop.start,crop.end) behaviour = classify_flap(PAM_data$acceleration, period = 12) PAM_data$acceleration$class = behaviour$classification==3

what: Editing of Pressure and Activity on Trainset
title: demo
text: matching pressure work correctly, need bird exactly location stationary period. likely manual editing activity classification required. suggest using TRAINNSET edit classification. following code export automatically generated classification. can editted TRAINSET, export back . Make sure keep classified file project folder (e.g. /data/) re-edit existing labeled file can simply re-open file trainset.geocene.com read file trainset.read. write another vignette best practice label activity pressure data.
code: PAM_data = trainset.edit(PAM_data, file.location=system.file("extdata", "/", package = "GeoPressureR")) # browseURL("https://trainset.geocene.com/") PAM_data = trainset.read(PAM_data, file.location=system.file("extdata", "/", package = "GeoPressureR"))

title: demo
text: Build data.frame stationary period. Assign pressure measure stationary period belong . Initially, might easier query stationary period certain duration.
code: sta = data.frame(   start = c(crop.start,behaviour$timetable$end),   end = c(behaviour$timetable$start,crop.end),   nextFlightDuration = c(behaviour$timetable$`Duration (h)`,0) ) sta$staID = 1:nrow(sta) staID = sapply(PAM_data$pressure$date, function(x) which(sta$start<=x & x<=sta$end)) staID[sapply(staID, function(x) length(x)==0)] = 0 PAM_data$pressure$staID = unlist(staID) min_duration = 60*24*16 # in minutes staID_keep = sta$staID[(sta$end-sta$start)>min_duration] PAM_data$pressure$staID[!(PAM_data$pressure$staID %in% staID_keep)] = NA

title: demo
text: part, query maps pressure GeoPressure API (see information github.com/Rafnuss/GeoPressureServer/). See details explanation parameter https://github.com/Rafnuss/GeoPressureServer/#request Compute probability map
code: extent = c(-6,26,4,53) # coordinates of the map to request (W,E,S,N)  scale = 1 # request on a 1° grid to make the code faster maxSample = 20 margin = 30 # roughly equivalent to 3hPa rasterList = geopressure.map(PAM_data$pressure, extent=c(-16,20,0,50), scale=scale, maxSample=maxSample, margin=margin) #> Sending requests... #> Request generated successfully for 5 stationary periods (1, 5, 16, 19, 28, ) #> Starting download: #>  [==========                                        ] 1 / 5 [====================                              ] 2 / 5 [==============================                    ] 3 / 5 [========================================          ] 4 / 5 [==================================================] 5 / 5 #> Receiving download (geotiff): #>  [==========                                        ] 1 / 5 [====================                              ] 2 / 5 [==============================                    ] 3 / 5 [========================================          ] 4 / 5 [==================================================] 5 / 5 s = 0.4 # standard deviation of pressure thr = 0.9 # threashold of value acceptable 2 rasterProbList = geopressure.Probmap(rasterList, s=s, thr=thr)

title: demo
code: i_r = 1;  leaflet() %>% addTiles() %>%   addRasterImage(rasterProbList[[i_r]], opacity = 0.8, group="Probability") %>%   addRasterImage(rasterList[[i_r]][[1]], opacity = 0.8, group="Mismatch") %>%   addRasterImage(rasterList[[i_r]][[2]], opacity = 0.8, group="Threashold") %>%   # addLegend(pal = pal, values = values(v[[i_s]][[3]]), title = "Probability") %>%    addLayersControl(     overlayGroups = c("Probability","Mismatch","Threashold"),     options = layersControlOptions(collapsed = FALSE)   ) %>% hideGroup(c("Mismatch","Threashold")) #> Warning in showSRID(uprojargs, format = "PROJ", multiline = "NO", prefer_proj = #> prefer_proj): Discarded ellps WGS 84 in Proj4 definition: +proj=merc +a=6378137 #> +b=6378137 +lat_ts=0 +lon_0=0 +x_0=0 +y_0=0 +k=1 +units=m +nadgrids=@null #> +wktext +no_defs +type=crs #> Warning in showSRID(uprojargs, format = "PROJ", multiline = "NO", prefer_proj = #> prefer_proj): Discarded datum World Geodetic System 1984 in Proj4 definition

title: demo
text: Visualize
code: i_r=1  i_s = metadata(rasterProbList[[i_r]])$staID  # find the max value of probability tmp = as.data.frame(rasterProbList[[i_r]],xy=T) lon = tmp$x[which.max(tmp[,3])] lat = tmp$y[which.max(tmp[,3])]  # filter pressure for the stationary period # include flight period before and after pres = PAM_data$pressure id = pres$staID==i_s & !is.na(pres$staID) pressure = list(   obs = pres$obs[id],   date = pres$date[id] )  # query the pressure at this location ptsr  = geopressure.timeseries(lon, lat, pressure = pressure) #> Sending requests... #> Request generated successfully. #> Downloading csv data. ggplot() +   geom_line(data=as.data.frame(pressure), aes(x=date,y=obs)) +   geom_point(data=as.data.frame(ptsr), aes(x=date,y=pressure))

title: demo
text: Standard processure following https://geolocationmanual.vogelwarte.ch/twilight.html Get twilight Calibraiton
code: #twl = twilightCalc(PAM_data$light$date, PAM_data$light$obs, LightThreshold = 2, ask = F) # d.calib = subset(twl, (tSecond<=head(behaviour$timetable$start,1)) |  #                        (tFirst>=tail(behaviour$timetable$end,1))) #  # gE = getElevation(twl = d.calib, known.coord = c(lon.calib, lat.calib),method = "gamma", plot = F) #  # crds = coord(twl, degElevation = 90-gE[1], note = FALSE) # tripMap(crds) # points(lon.calib, lat.calib, pch = 21, cex = 1.5, bg = "white") # adding the release location

title: Authors and Citation
text: Rapaël Nussbaumer. Author, maintainer. Mathieu Gravey. Author.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Nussbaumer R, Gravey M (2021). GeoPressureR: Location Reanalysed Pressure. R package version 1.0.
code: @Manual{,   title = {GeoPressureR: Location from Reanalysed Pressure},   author = {Rapaël Nussbaumer and Mathieu Gravey},   year = {2021},   note = {R package version 1.0}, }

title: Location from Reanalysed Pressure
text: goal GeoPressureR help researcher analyse pressure measurement made geolocator. particular, provides R wrapper around .

title: Location from Reanalysed Pressure
text: can install development version GeoPressureR GitHub :
code: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("Rafnuss/GeoPressureR")

title: Location from Reanalysed Pressure
text: Documentation Vignette demo

title: Location from Reanalysed Pressure
text: Multiple package analyse light: GeoLight PAMLr: Extensive toolbox analyse multi-sensor geolocator. R/PAM.R directly package. GeoPressure API GEE

title: Classify flapping flight — classify_flap
text: function uses activity data classify migratory flapping flight.

title: Classify flapping flight — classify_flap
code: classify_flap(dta, period = 12, tz = "UTC")

title: Classify flapping flight — classify_flap
text: dta data stored list see str(data(PAM_data)) example format period number timepoints behaviour considered migratory e.g. hoopoes, 3x5min = 15 minutes intense activity considered flight tz timezone, default "UTC"

title: Classify flapping flight — classify_flap
text: timetable: timetable species migrating , classification: classification timeseries datetime corresponds activity, no_movement: value classification corresponds movement low_movement: value classification corresponds low activity high_movement: value classification corresponds high activity migration: value classification corresponds migratory flapping flight threshold: threshold low high activity

what: Crop all sensor data to the same timeframe — create_crop
title: Crop all sensor data to the same timeframe — create_crop
text: Get rid excess data. e.g. logger kept rucksack lab downloaded.

title: Crop all sensor data to the same timeframe — create_crop
code: create_crop(dta, start, end)

title: Crop all sensor data to the same timeframe — create_crop
text: dta path files stored start posicxt object date PAM data start end posicxt object date PAM data end

title: Crop all sensor data to the same timeframe — create_crop
text: shortened PAM data

title: Import PAM data — create_import
text: Imports formats many datasets one big nested list containing data different sensors. subset sensors can selected using measurements.

title: Import PAM data — create_import
code: create_import(   pathname = pathname,   measurements = c(".pressure", ".glf", ".acceleration", ".temperature", ".magnetic") )

title: Import PAM data — create_import
text: pathname path files stored measurements series measurements logged PAM logger imported. Currently supports file extentions: ".pressure", ".glf", ".gle",".acceleration", ".temperature", "AirTemperature", ".BodyTemperature" ".magnetic"

title: Import PAM data — create_import
text: list measurements one individual

title: Convert MSE to probability — geopressure.Probmap
text: function

title: Convert MSE to probability — geopressure.Probmap
code: geopressure.Probmap(rasterList, s = 1, thr = 0.9)

title: Convert MSE to probability — geopressure.Probmap
text: rasterList list raster loaded geopressure.map() s standardeviation pressure error thr threashold percentage datapoint outside elevation range considered possible

title: Convert MSE to probability — geopressure.Probmap
text: List probability raster map

what: Request and download mismatch maps of pressure — geopressure.map
title: Request and download mismatch maps of pressure — geopressure.map
text: function return mismatch map atmospheric pressure measured geolocator (PAM_data). performs following actions: (1) Send query produce Google Earth Engine (GEE) url code producing maps stationary periods separately, (2) read map (geotiff) raster (3) compute likelihood map mismatch

title: Request and download mismatch maps of pressure — geopressure.map
code: geopressure.map(pressure, extent, scale = 10, maxSample = 250, margin = 30)

title: Request and download mismatch maps of pressure — geopressure.map
text: pressure pressure list PAM logger dataset list (see https://github.com/KiranLDA/PAMLr details). extent Geographical extend map query list ordered West,East,South,North  (e.g. c(-6,43,0,47)) scale Number pixel per latitude, longitude. 10 resoltion 0.1° (~10) 4 resolution 0.25° (~30km). avoid interpolating ERA5 data, scale smaller 10. Read scale Google earth Engine documention. maxSample computation mismatch performed maxSample datapoints pressure reduce computational time. samples randomly (uniformly) selected timeserie. margin margin used threshold map accept measurement error. unit meter. (1hPa~10m)

title: Request and download mismatch maps of pressure — geopressure.map
text: List raster map

what: Request and download surface pressure timeseries at location — geopressure.timeseries
title: Request and download surface pressure timeseries at location — geopressure.timeseries
text: function return surfrace atmospheric pressure timeseries ERA5 particualy location specify lat lon. uses SRTM-30 translate pressure exact elevation ground level, accounting temporal varation pressure temperature.

title: Request and download surface pressure timeseries at location — geopressure.timeseries
code: geopressure.timeseries(   lon,   lat,   pressure = NULL,   endTime = NULL,   startTime = NULL )

title: Request and download surface pressure timeseries at location — geopressure.timeseries
text: lon longitude query (-180° 180°). lat latitude query (0° 90°). pressure pressure list PAM logger dataset list (see https://github.com/KiranLDA/PAMLr details). endTime starttime startTime pressure provided, starttime timeserie return needed

title: Request and download surface pressure timeseries at location — geopressure.timeseries
text: Timeserie date, pressure optionally altitude

title: Request and download surface pressure timeseries at location — geopressure.timeseries
text: supply pressure (time) geolocator, additionally return elevation geolocator sea level considering bird located location specify

what: Edit classification of activity and pressure — trainset.edit
title: Edit classification of activity and pressure — trainset.edit
text: function perform three steps: (1) write csv file automatically labeled activity pressure trainset.write, (2) open trainset broweser (https://trainset.geocene.com/) can edit labels (3) read exported csv file trainset trainset.read.

title: Edit classification of activity and pressure — trainset.edit
code: trainset.edit(   PAM_data,   file.location,   file.name = paste0(PAM_data$id, "_act_pres") )

title: Edit classification of activity and pressure — trainset.edit
text: PAM_data PAM logger dataset list (see https://github.com/KiranLDA/PAMLr details) file.location Path folder labeled files saved file.name Name file.

title: Edit classification of activity and pressure — trainset.edit
text: PAM logger dataset list updated new label named class (PAM_data$pressure$class PAM_data$acceleration$class)

what: Read classification of activity and pressure — trainset.read
title: Read classification of activity and pressure — trainset.read
text: function read exported csv file trainset (https://trainset.geocene.com/) update PAM logger dataset

title: Read classification of activity and pressure — trainset.read
code: trainset.read(   PAM_data,   file.location,   file.name = paste0(PAM_data$id, "_act_pres") )

title: Read classification of activity and pressure — trainset.read
text: PAM_data PAM logger dataset list (see https://github.com/KiranLDA/PAMLr details) file.location Path folder labeled file . file.name Name file.

title: Read classification of activity and pressure — trainset.read
text: PAM logger dataset list updated new label named class (PAM_data$pressure$class PAM_data$acceleration$class)

what: Write classification of activity and pressure — trainset.write
title: Write classification of activity and pressure — trainset.write
text: function writes csv file automatically labeled activity pressure can read TRAINSET (https://trainset.geocene.com/).

title: Write classification of activity and pressure — trainset.write
code: trainset.write(   PAM_data,   file.location,   file.name = paste0(PAM_data$id, "_act_pres") )

title: Write classification of activity and pressure — trainset.write
text: PAM_data PAM logger dataset list (see https://github.com/KiranLDA/PAMLr details) file.location Path folder labeled files saved file.name Name file.
